parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: Filter to specify a zone. This is used in conjunction with filterValues and/or filterEmpty flag.

parameters.name: factorId
parameters.description: Filter to specify a factor. This is used in conjunction with filterValues and/or filterEmpty flag.

parameters.name: filterValues
parameters.description: This requires zoneId and/or factorId to be specified. If set to true the returned ambiances will contain values matching the specified filters.

parameters.name: filterEmpty
parameters.description: If set to true, empty ambiances won't be returned. If this is used without filter enable and zoneId and/or factorId specified, it will return only ambiances that have at least on value matching the specified zoneId/factorId.

parameters.name: ambianceId
parameters.description: Identifier of the ambiance to apply.

parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: If specified, the ambiance will be applied only to this zone. If this zone is a meta zone, the ambiance will be applied to all of it's sub zones.

parameters.name: factorId
parameters.description: If specified, the ambiance will be applied only for this factor.

parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: Filters applied to ambiance's value. If specified, the retrieved ambiance will only contain values matching this zoneId.

parameters.name: factorId
parameters.description: Filters applied to ambiance's value. If specified, the retrieved ambiance will only contain values matching this factorId.

parameters.name: ambianceId
parameters.description: Identifier of the ambiance to be updated

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new value of the ambiance

parameters.name: ambianceId
parameters.description: Identifier of the ambiance to apply.

get.description: Required permission: ambiances_current_read. Get the for each zone and factor the selected ambiance

post.description: Required permission: ambiances_reset. Clear ambiances for the specified zone and or factor.

parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: Filter that specify a zone that should be reset. If unspecified the reset will be applied cross zone. If the zone is a meta zone, the reset will be applied to all          of it's subzones.

parameters.name: factorId
parameters.description: Filter that specify a factor that should be reset. If unspecified the reset will be applied to all factor.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the queried data source type

422.description: No data source type is matching for the given ID.

get.summary: Get the time series data. Allow a custom selection according to multiple filters.
get.description: Required permission: data_read. Returns a list of series (from 0 to x) depending on the wideness of the chosen filters. The answer could be : SUCCESS (all requested data retrieved), PARTIAL (data retrieved but some synthesis points are missing in the requested interval), FAIL (no data points for this resquest), ERROR (problem occured while requesting). If the answer is PARTIAL, the missing data gaps are given in the "missingPeriods" field. The performed query is always given back : its fields "pagingNewBeginDate" and "pagingNewEndDate" is specified when answer is too big and the dataprovider is paging (this date will be the limit (begin or end) of the next request to call).

parameters.name: measurement
parameters.description: measurement filter, represents the type of the data (with a specific unit, or no unit for qualitative series) (ex. TEMP for temperature in Â°C)

parameters.name: nature
parameters.description: nature filter, it is the type of source, out of values : SEN, ACT, FACT, PRED, EXT, IT, TAR (for respectively : SENsors, ACTuators, FACTors, PREDiction, EXTernal_info, Intelligent Things, TARget)

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: group filter : group is a sub-category for a measurement (ex. TEMP), most of the time it is the ID of the environmental factor in Hemis (ex. TMP, VALVE_TMP ...)

parameters.name: dsid
parameters.description: unique ID of the data source (ex. a sensorID, an actuatorID ...)

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: zone filter : the ID of a specific zone (ex. Kitchen_1234 ) OR "outside" (reserved string) for data from outside the building (ex. weather) OR an IT_STATE component (ex. PAIR_ST) [in this case zone is used instead of group for optimisation purposes]

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: granularity : accuracy of data synthesis i.e. duration between 2 values in s. (ex. 1 value/1h = 3600) [Default: 0 (real time)]

parameters.name: begin
parameters.description: Begin date (timestamp in ms) [Default: no begin date, i.e. all data until end date]

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End date (timestamp in ms) [Default: no end date, i.e. all data from begin date]

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields separated by ";" (out of : VALUENB;VALUESTR;MINIMUM;MAXIMUM;MAXIMUMOCC;LAST;AVERAGE;RELIABILITY;NBPOINT;DIFF) [Default: all available fields]

parameters.name: cpid
parameters.description: Custom persistence ID of the data source Type (Reserved for persistence policy customisation of different sources sharing a common source type) [in order to select only a dataSourceTypes without a cpid specify cpid=""]

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: Get only the n last points in chronological order (most recent points) (use negative number -n to get the n first points (oldest points))

500.description: Something went wrong with authorizations management

get.summary: Get the data source type ontology.

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Set to true to get the exhaustive ontology even if the data is not present in this building

patch.summary: Add a new persistence description for each data source given in parameter (using its ID).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A map where the key is the ID of a data source type and the value is the corresponding new persistence description we want to set.

422.description: An ID is matching no data source type.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: group filter : group is a sub-category for a measurement (ex. TEMP), most of the time it is the ID of the environmental factor in Hemis (ex. TMP, VALVE_TMP ...)

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: zone filter : the ID of a specific zone (ex. Kitchen_1234 ) OR "outside" (reserved string) for data from outside the building (ex. weather) OR an IT_STATE component (ex. PAIR_ST) [in this case zone is used instead of group for optimisation purposes]

parameters.description: Number of its returned by the request.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: If the hemis contains 6 intelligent-things, size is set at 3 and index at 2, the request will return intelligent-things [2,3,4].

parameters.name: reset
parameters.description: If true, all known instance specific data will be erased.

parameters.name: overrideType
parameters.description: If false or unspecified the type information will be retrieved from quickmove. Otherwise type information should be send along with the intelligent-thing.

parameters.name: useVirtualConfig
parameters.description: Used only if 'correspondigVirtualIt' is set. If true, instance specific configuration will be overriden by those of the virtual it. Otherwise the intelligent-thing configuration from this request will be used as is.

parameters.name: ITInformation
parameters.description: If false or unspecified the returned object wil be an ITClientDetail. Otherwise an ITInformation will be returned.

parameters.description: If false or unspecified the returned object wil be an ITClientDetail. Otherwise an ITInformation will be returned.

put.summary: Update the properties of a kernel.
put.description: Required permission: containers_kernels_properties_write. All the properties of the kernel must be passed as argument. If some required argument are missing a 404 response will be returned. To update only some properties see 'PATCH /properties'.

parameters.description: If some properties are unknow for this hemis version, an error will be returned. This flag can be used to force writting the property to the file system for future migrations.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Complete of the updated kernel properties.

patch.summary: Update the properties of a kernel.

parameters.name: getActual
parameters.description: true to get applicable tarifications (default: true)

parameters.name: getVirtual
parameters.description: true to get virtual tarifications (default: false)

parameters.name: getCurrent
parameters.description: true to get currently applicable tarifications (default: false)
